name: Word Search3 Quiz | Word Play | 25 Questions

questions.text: I gave up my job because of mosquitoes?
questions.explanation:
Quit & quit.

	mosQUIToes. Quit is to give up.

questions.text: Robert Mitchum is a close friend of mine?
questions.explanation:
Chum & chum.

	mitCHUM. A friend is a chum.

questions.text: The ostrich need not bury his head in the sand as he's well supplied with wealth?
questions.explanation:
Rich & rich.

	ostRICH. Well supplied with wealth is to be rich.

questions.text: The horse called 'Spencer Tracy' is certain to win the race?
questions.explanation:
Cert & cert & Racy & racy.

	spenCER Tracy or CERTain. Cert is informally something that is a certainty. 'Racy' has also been added. tRACY.

questions.text: What pleasure, amusement or merriment can be sought from a funeral?
questions.explanation:
Fun & fun.

	FUNeral. Pleasure or amusement is fun.

questions.text: The strong jaws and sharp teeth of a piranha is Persia's modern name?
questions.explanation:
Iran & iran.

	pIRANah. Persia's modern name is Iran.

questions.text: The aromatic Eurasian plant was found inside the armadillo?
questions.explanation:
Dill & dill.

	armaDILLo. Dill is an aromatic Eurasian plant.

questions.text: The remains of the Ugandan soldier and dictator were found inside a flamingo belonging to Liza Minnelli?
questions.explanation:
Amin & amin.

	flAMINgo or lizA MINnelli. Idi Amin was the Ugandan dictator.

questions.text: To remove unwanted matter from the Mediterranean Sea?
questions.explanation:
Edit & edit.

	mEDITerranean. Edit is to remove unwanted matter.

questions.text: The German, Pole, Swede or any other European could provide a murder weapon used in the game of 'Cluedo'?
questions.explanation:
Rope & rope.

	euROPEan. Rope being a murder weapon used in 'Cluedo'.

questions.text: The Communion table is as solid as the Rock of Gibraltar?
questions.explanation:
Altar & altar.

	gibrALTAR. A communion table is the altar.

questions.text: The site of the most famous oracle of Apollo can be found at Philadelphia?
questions.explanation:
Delphi & delphi.

	philaDELPHIa. The site of the most famous oracle of Apollo is at Delphi.

questions.text: John Travolta helped this Italian physicist to invent the electroscope.
questions.explanation:
Volta & volta.

	traVOLTA. Alessandro Volta was the Italian physicist who invented the electroscope and after whom the volt is named.

questions.text: The Gobi desert provides a narrow sash worn by Japanese men?
questions.explanation:
Obi & obi.

	gOBI. Narrow sash worn by Japanese men is the obi?

questions.text: Can an octopus compose a musical work?
questions.explanation:
Opus & opus.

	octOPUS. A musical work is called an opus.

questions.text: Countess is the female equivalent of the human pearl diver?
questions.explanation:
Earl & earl.

	pEARL. Countess is the female equivalent of an earl.

questions.text: The French and Germans say yes to the Ouija board?
questions.correct: Ouija & ouija & Oui & oui & Ja & ja
questions.explanation:
Ouija & ouija & Oui & oui & Ja & ja.

	Ouija board means yes in French (Oui) and yes in German (Ja).

questions.text: How can a man who does not behave in a gentlemanly manner towards others win an Academy Award?
questions.explanation:
Cad & cad.

	aCADemy. A man who does not behave in a gentlemanly way towards others is a cad.

questions.text: Does the basilisk lizard manage 'Fawlty Towers'?
questions.explanation:
Basil & basil.

	BASILisk. Basil Fawlty played brilliantly by John Cleese manages 'Fawlty Towers'.

questions.text: Rowan Atkinson AKA Mr. Bean gave a mountain ash performance, so wooden?
questions.explanation:
Rowan & rowan.

	Another name for the Mountain Ash tree is rowan.

questions.text: The beluga, a large white sturgeon, needed to plead, press or move someone to do something?
questions.explanation:
Urge & urge & Test & test.

	stURGEon. Urge is to plead, press or move someone to do something. whiTE STurgeon (test) is an alternative answer supplied by Alan-SouthAust. Cheers, Al.

questions.text: Can the Italian for five, be found in the Cinque Ports of Hastings, Romney, Hythe, Dover or Sandwich?
questions.explanation:
Cinque & cinque.

	Cinque is the Italian word for five.

questions.text: South American Indians use curare as an arrow poison and survival is not widely known.
questions.explanation:
Rare & rare.

	cuRARE. Not widely known is rare.

questions.text: Are barracuda found around an island in North-West Scotland in the Outer Hebrides?
questions.explanation:
Barra & barra.

	Barra is the Island in North-West Scotland.

questions.text: In Greek Mythology, a nymph who, spurned by Narcissus, pined away until only her voice remained in Czechoslovakia?
questions.explanation:
Echo & echo.

	czECHOslovakia. The nymph was called Echo. Hope you enjoyed the quiz.
